results.title: History of a day
results.brief_description:
The time lapse photography in History of a Day offers an exhilarating view of a ‘day’ unfolding before our eyes in just four minutes. The five screens of the installation surround the viewer with multiple sunrises, sunsets and lightning storms - a global dance of energy and light not available to us from our usual fixed and single perspective.

History of a Day shows us the Earth as a spinning ball of elements, driven by the laws of gravity and physics, producing, in the words of the artists, ‘a cosmic special effects theatre in continuous production, simultaneously all over the earth.’

Cinematographer Simon Carroll has been photographing time-lapse sequences for twenty years, and has amassed a large archive of material from which History of a Day was constructed. His work has been used in many films, including The Matrix (1999). Composer Martin Friedel has written music for film, theatre, opera and the concert hall, using both traditional and new media forms. He is currently a Creative Fellow at the State Library of Victoria.

(FT 30.03.05)

results.title: Chain times three
results.brief_description:
As regional character disappears and corporate culture homogenizes our surroundings, it’s increasingly hard to tell where you are. Landscapes from L.A. to New Jersey, Vancouver to Melbourne, share a strange indeterminate quality. A new Wal-Mart megastore opens, somewhere, every four days. CHAIN is a multi-screen installation in CHAIN, this global, ‘superlandscape’ sets the mood and serves as mortar for a series of linked narratives and mini-documentaries that will be joined into a unique hybrid feature. CHAIN explores the effects on humans of an altered environment made not only of architecture and geography, but of the shift in economic and social horizons brought on by the increasing commercialism and surveillance that mark the ‘Age of Information’.

Cohen was in residence with ACMI during 2000. The idea for this project was developed during his time in residency.

results.title: Experiments in motion graphics
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: In this documentary film exploring his working processes, John Whitney explains some of the techniques and philosophies involved in programming and animating his computer-made abstract films. He attempts to define his new art of ‘motion graphics’ by comparison with music and language. As well as an intriguing investigation into his work, this film is a visual feast of his remarkable dynamic abstractions.

results.title: Le Voyage dans la Lune (A Trip to the Moon)

video_links.name: Le Voyage dans la Lune (A Trip to the Moon)

results.brief_description: Melies’ fantastical vision of life on the moon.

constellations_other.name: Space, sci-fi and cinema fakes
constellations_other.description: Magic lantern slides were used to entertain and educate audiences in home, theatres and universities. While performers told jokes and fairytales, travelling showmen unveiled exotic locations and scientists revealed the latest discoveries.

results.title_for_label: Le Voyage dans la Lune (A Trip to the Moon)
results.description: One of the first Science Fiction films, this Melies’ short humorously proposes what man discovers when he first lands on the moon. Based on the Jules Verne story, George Melies used his extraordinary cinematic illusions to tell this story of the first voyage to the moon. Made in 1902, this was a visionary film that has come to be recognised as a cinematic masterpiece. Among the many comical set pieces is the famous scene in which a rocket ship crash-lands into the eye of the ‘man in the moon’. This whimsical fantasy is also exemplary in its early depiction of the moon and the possible encounters between humans and worlds beyond our imagining, in our exploration of deep space.
description_for_label: One of the first Science Fiction films, this Melies’ short humorously proposes what man discovers when he first lands on the moon. results.title: Innamorati
results.brief_description:
Assembled from family photographs, home movies and background music, Roberta Ciabarra narrates a poignant story of her parent’s courtship and unusual marriage as they migrate separately to Australia to establish a new life.

First created as part of the pilot 3 day digital storytelling workshop conducted at Cinemedia by Nina Mullen and Joe Lambert from the Center for Digital Storytelling, Berkeley, CA.

results.title: Rabbit Control [Part 1: Poisoning with 1080]
results.creator_credit: Ian Blythman, John Atkins and Conservation Forests and Lands
results.brief_description: This program narrated by Maurie Fields shows the problem of pest control in rural Victoria, and the adverse effects on farming if rabbit populations are not controlled. Part 1 explains the proper steps and procedure in using the poison 1080, the various safety precautions, equipment and supplies and tidy up details.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ian Blythman, John Atkins and Conservation Forests and Lands

results.title: Achievements in salinity control
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture and Rural Affairs
results.brief_description: Looks at the problem of salinity and its effects on irrigated agriculture. Explains the formation of the water table and the resultant salinity due to poor drainage and evaporation. Focuses on a number of strategies and research developments to combat the problem.
